The historical markings, also called innovation numbers, are computed sim=
ply by a counter.  Every time a new gene appears through a complexifying mu=
tation, the historical marking counter for that type of gene is incremented=
 by 1.  For example, if it is a connection gene, then the connection gene c=
ounter is incremented by 1.  When genes are inherited from parents by their=
 offspring, their historical markings never change.  Therefore, the origin =
of every gene is permanently recorded by the historical marking.

ken

--- =
